name: MBS administration web console
description:
The administration console provides a simple interface to manage users and services.

The console is extensible and will provide more and more features as soon as you install other addons on your MBS. The console can be access through your network with a simple browser.

The base installation allows you to manage :

* The users and groups ;
* System services ;
* The firewall.

Requirements :

* IE6+, Firefox 3.5+, Safari & Chrome all versions.

name: Windows users and file sharing management
description:
Authenticate Windows users with SAMBA and provide Windows file shares on your network.

Your MBS server will act as a Windows domain controller. Windows computers can be added to the MBS domain and domain users are managed through the MBS administration console. Existing accounts can also be upgraded to work with Windows clients.

File sharing management is done in the administration console too.

name: User quota management
description:
Control disk space usage of your users on the server.

You can set any space limit for all your users or specific users. Limits can be applied on any filesystem of your server.

This addon is useful in combination with the [Windows file sharing](http://serviceplace.mandriva.com/addons/mds_smb/8/) addon.

The management of user's quotas is done in the MBS administration console.

Requirements :

* Filesystem in ext3, ext4 or XFS

name: Mail service
description:
A complete mail service with POP/IMAP, anti-virus and anti-spam toolkits.

This addon will configure on your server a complete, rock-solid mail system. With anti-spam ([SpamAssassin](http://spamassassin.apache.org/)), block lists ([SpamCop](http://www.spamcop.net/), [Spamhaus](http://www.spamhaus.org/) ...) and anti-virus ([ClamAV](http://www.clamav.net)) the service is finely tuned out of the box.

Postfix and Dovecot provides SMTP, IMAP and POP3 functionnalities. Each of these services are also SSL enabled so you can use the SSL flavour of these protocols (SMTPS, IMAPS, POP3S).

Multiple mail domains and user's email properties (aliases, forward, quota...) are supported and managed through the MBS administration console.

name: Webmail
description:
A simple and powerful webmail for your mail service.

Configure the well known [Roundcube](http://roundcube.net/) webmail on your server. This addon will trigger the installation of the mail service [mail service](http://serviceplace.mandriva.com/addons/mds_mail/10/).

The managesieve plugin is preconfigured so that users can define sieve rules from the webmail (auto reponse for vacation, for example).

Main features :

* Drag-&-drop message management
* Full support for MIME and HTML messages
* Compose messages with attachments
* Find-as-you-type address book integration
* Spell checking
* IMAP folder management
* Built-in caching for fast mailbox access

Compatible browsers :

* Internet Explorer 6+
* Safari 3+
* Firefox 3+
* Google Chrome 9+

name: Calendar and addressbook sharing
description:
Share your calendars and addresses with CalDAV and CardDAV protocols.

This addon installs and configures the DAViCal service for sharing calendars and address books. Calendars are integrated in the [webmail](http://serviceplace.mandriva.com/addons/mds_webmail/11/).

See the [DAViCal documentation](http://www.davical.org/clients.php) on how to add calendars on mail clients.

name: Instant messaging service
description: Provides a Jabber service for your organization.

name: Printing service
description:
Manage printers on your network.

Install the well known [Cups service](http://www.cups.org/) that provides an easy to use interface for managing printers, especially network printers.

If you have installed the [SAMBA service](http://serviceplace.mandriva.com/addons/mds_smb/8/) the printers will also be shared to Windows clients. 

Tip: on Linux desktops install cups to get automatically the printers list of your server.

name: DHCP Service
description:
Automatically configure network settings on client computers.

The DHCP service will configure all the network settings of the client computers in your local network. All the options of the DHCP protocol are supported including support for PXE servers or automatic proxy configuration (PAC).

DHCP subnets can be configured from the MBS administration console. On each subnet you will be able to define dedicated DHCP options and configure one or more dynamic IP pools.

The popular [isc dhcp software](https://www.isc.org/software/dhcp) is used to provide this service.

name: DNS Service
description:
Resolve computer names on your network or on Internet.

The DNS service can be used to resolve computers names for public or internal domains. 

Beware that for a public domain your server must be reachable from Internet.

Features:

* On the fly DNS addition of zones through the MBS administration console,
* In a breeze configuration of all types of DNS entries (A, CNAME, MX...).

The popular [bind software](https://www.isc.org/software/bind) is used to provide this service.

name: SSH key management
description: Manage your user's SSH key using LDAP as a backend
